intro: Peltaria caramaniensis, commonly known as the Caramanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
